definition: Jinguashi, town in Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan, noted for its historic gold and copper mines, used as a prisoner-of-war camp by the Japanese (1942-1945)
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
melon/gourd/squash
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: These truly were Chinkuashi's golden days.
sentences.chinese: 那时真是金瓜石的黄金时期。

sentences.english: Jewelry shops and restaurants featuring Chinese and Japanese cuisine crowded the streets.
sentences.chinese: 珠店和中日风味的餐厅挤满了金瓜石的街道。
